attributes.comment:
While I recognise the need for any Dept to be fully funded, it is just unrealistic to
think that hiking up fees is the only way forward. How can the mandarins in the
USCIS justify such massive fees increases, when the service offered is slow,
unresponsive and at times down right hostile to those who have to use it.
The correlation between price increases and productivity levels is unproven. The
USCIS should be looking for better ways of working and for being fully funded by
the Congress rather than hiding behind price increases which the ordinary person
in the USA would not stand for. If US citizen had to use this service there would be
an outcry throughout the land. During my processing I've been made to feel almost
like a criminal, and yet you want to make me pay for for this 'privilege'!
If I make a move to become permanent, then you'll be looking to freeze me out by
way of costs, and no guarantee of a better, smoother system!l
Even with all the correct paperwork, status and visas, getting in and out of the
country without secondary interviews seems like a lottery. But it shouldn't be so.
Come on legislators, treat potential immigrants with respect and fairness,
streamline the system and speed up the processes, but don't penalize us by way
of exhorbitant fees, aka a 'tax' for having to be processed.
I love the USA, her people and her heritage, but I'm loathe to give my name for fear
of reprisal, how sad! God Bless America!
